TEXT.TITLE: CCC ACCEPTS EXPORT BONUS ON SEMOLINA TO EGYPT
TEXT.BODY: The Commodity Credit Corporation, CCC, has accepted a bid for an export bonus to cover a sale of 6,000 tonnes of semolina to Egypt, the U.S. Agriculture Department said. The department said the semolina is for shipment April-October, 1987, and the bonus awarded was 224.87 dlrs per tonne. The bonus was made to International Multifoods Corp and will paid to the exporter in the form of commodities from CCC stocks, the department said. An additional 7,000 tonnes of semolina are still available to Egypt under the Export Enhancement Program initiative announced August 1, 1986, it said. Reuter
